text: Overdose and substance use cases continue to grow across our country and we cannot turn a blind eye. I lost two of my brothers to addiction and I want to make sure no other family ever feels the same pain that my family and I experienced.

I wrote a letter to @FEMA urging that they extend the application deadline of May 17 for Critical Needs Assistance (CNA) related to the wildfires currently raging in our state. This is a developing emergency & FEMA must provide New Mexicans equal access to this program. https://t.co/03FLI0ZwRR
If you apply by May 17, 2022, you may also be eligible for Critical Needs Assistance, which provides a one-time $500 payment to cover immediate needs, including food, water, and medication.

If the fires impact you or someone you know, you should apply for federal disaster assistance with FEMA as soon as you can. Find out more and apply by:

We listened with tears in our eyes and purpose in our hearts to tragic stories of the treatment of young Native American children, who were torn from their parents, torn from the culture, torn from their homelands, & forced into conditions that would be decried as torture today.

During #Women'sHealthWeek, we renew our commitment to ensuring the health and well-being of women and girls across, advancing health equity, and working to defend reproductive rights and high-quality, affordable care across our Nation. Health care is a right, not a privilege.

Everyone in New Mexico is grieving over the loss of our beautiful forests, communities & memories. We will not replace our lifetimes with the forest landscape. But the federal government can & must take responsibility for the harm the prescribed burn unleashed on our homelands.

Yesterday, I introduced the Hermit's Peak Fire Assistance Act to fully compensate New Mexicans and business owners who have been impacted by the Hermit's Peak/Calf Canyon Fire. https://t.co/9bRezrwQ2N
